spider

Class Spider

  • java.lang.Object
    • spider.Spider

  • public class Spider
extends java.lang.Object
    Downloads web page content starting with a starting url. If the spider encounters links in the content, it downloads those as well. Steps: 1. Complete the processPage method. One TestSpider unit tests should pass. 2. Complete the crawl() method. Both TestSpider unit tests should pass.
    Author:
    shilad

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.List<java.lang.String> finished
      URLs that have already been retrieved.
      private HttpHelper helper
      Helps download and parse the web pages.
      private int maxUrls
      Maximum number of urls that should be scraped.
      private AllWordsCounter urlCounter
      Keeps track of counts for each url.
      private java.util.Queue<java.lang.String> work
      Urls waiting to be scraped.

    • Method Detail

      • crawl

        public void crawl(java.lang.String beginningUrl)
        Crawls at most maxUrls starting with beginningUrl.
        Parameters:
        beginningUrl - Starting URL, indicating a web page that potentially contains other URLs.

      • processPage

        public void processPage(java.lang.String url)
        Retrieves content from a url and processes that content.
        Parameters:
        url - A URL to process.

      • getUrlCounts

        public WordCount[] getUrlCounts()
        Returns the number of times the spider encountered links to each url. The url are returned in increasing frequency order.
        Returns:
        Number of URLs encountered.
